Events

Talk on Polarisation and Spread of Misinformation on Social Media

Event/  3rd January, 2023, 11:00 am – 12:00 pm / SINES, NUST Sector H-12 Islamabad

Brief Description

Contrary to expectations that the increased connectivity offered by the internet and particularly Online Social Networks (OSNs) would result in a broad consensus on contentious issues, this talk emphasizes on the frequent observation of the formation of polarised echo chambers, in which only one side of an argument is entertained.

READ MORE

Talk on Connecting Language and Vision: Hierarchical Image Classification

Event/  23 December, 2022, 9:30 am – 10:30 am / SEECS Seminar Hall, NUST Sector H-12 Islamabad

Brief Description

This lecture address gives an overview of a novel mask-based output layer for multi-level hierarchical classification. Specifically, this lecture will cover a model-agnostic output layer that embeds the taxonomy and that can be combined with any model.

READ MORE

Talk on AI for 3D faces and Lumbar Spine Images: Challenges, Solutions and Applications

Event/  21 December, 2022, 10:00 am – 11:00 am / SINES, NUST Sector H-12 Islamabad

Brief Description

This talk will focus on the problem of establishing dense correspondence between a large number of 3D faces, the challenges faced and my contributions in this field. It will then take the audience through the applications of 3D face analysis in medical and psychological fields as well as in face recognition through deep learning.

READ MORE

Event/ 14 September, 2022, 10:00 am – 4:00 pm / SINES, NUST Sector H-12 Islamabad

Brief Description

Deep Learning Lab (DLL) organised the industry gathering to present their research to the trade. The purpose of the event was to gain industry exposure for the pertinent items and evaluate the commercialisation prospects of the projects being carried out under DLL.

READ MORE

Talk on Introduction to Neural Rendering

Event/ 14 September, 2022, 12:00 pm – 1:00 pm / Seecs Seminar Hall, NUST, H-12, Islamabad

Brief Description

A new type of deep picture and video production technique called neural rendering allows for explicit or implicit management of scene characteristics like lighting, camera settings, position, geometry, appearance, and semantic content. The aim of this talk was to give insights into how neural rendering, with a discussion of the social implications of this technology and investigate open research problems.

READ MORE

Talk on Transformers: Revolutionizing Automatic Text Understanding

Event/ 14 September, 2022, 11:00 am – 12:00 am / Seecs Seminar Hall, NUST, H-12, Islamabad

Brief Description

Transformers are among the go-to models in Artificial Intelligence these days. In this talk, the goal was to highlight the capability of Transformers and how they quickly became helpful for other tasks ranging from vision or audio and music applications all the way to playing chess or doing math!

READ MORE

Talk on the Importance of Memories in AI Hardware Accelerator

Event/ 14 September, 2022, 10:30 am – 11:00 am / Seecs Seminar Hall, NUST, H-12, Islamabad

Brief Description

Given that processing speed and scalability are two key demands from AI applications, AI accelerators play a critical role in delivering the near-instantaneous results that make these applications valuable. The aim of this talk was to highlight the significance of memory in AI accelerators.

READ MORE

Talk on Forest Monitoring using 3D Modeling for Trees

Event/ 12 September, 2022, 3:00 pm – 4:00 pm / Seecs Conference Room, NUST, H-12, Islamabad

Brief Description

Forest monitoring and change detection systems employ remote sensing data provided by optical satellite sensors due to the availability of open access time-series data of global coverage. The aim of this talk was to highlight the 3D Modeling techniques for Forest Monitoring.

READ MORE

Talk on Artificial Intelligence in Pakistan: Challenges and Opportunities

Event/ 6 September, 2022, 3:00 pm – 4:00 pm / Seecs Seminar Hall, NUST, H-12, Islamabad

Brief Description

AI disrupts every walk of life, e.g., service operation optimization, product enhancement, supply chain management, and manufacturing. One of the most notable benefits of using AI in all those areas is a significant cost decrease – up to more than 50% in some cases. However, the adoption of AI is slow in Pakistan, and it has not been able to penetrate the socioeconomic settings fully. This talk highlights how AI can help solve some fundamental problems in Pakistan and how the Sino-Pak Center for AI is helping achieve these goals.

READ MORE

5-Day Training on Deep Learning for Document Analysis and Recognition

Training/ 5th – 9th April, 2021, 10:00 am – 5:00 pm / Online

Brief Description

Deep Learning has been the forefront for document analysis and recognition (DAR) and has acquired immense research attention in recent years. To provide the participants with different aspects and in-depth analysis of the latest research being carried out in the field of document understanding, a five-day workshop has been arranged by Deep Learning Lab, NCAI and SEECS.  

READ MORE

5-Day Training on Deep Learning for Object Detection and Recognition

Training/ 1st – 5th March, 2021, 10:00 am – 5:00 pm / Online

Brief Description

Object Detection and Recognition training is to acquaint the learners with theoretical and practical knowledge of Object Detection & Recognition, and its interesting applications. The workshop will help the participants get a deep dive into the underlying architecture and algorithms and get hands-on experience with the training of deep learning models.  

READ MORE

5-Day Training on Automatic Speech Recognition

Training/ 15th – 19th Feb, 2021, 10:00 am – 5:00 pm / Online

Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) has altered the way the humans interact with the machines. It has been an intensive research topic for the past two decades and has found wide-ranging applications including the extraction of valuable insights from real-time telephonic transcriptions, improving customer service in a call center, performing semantic analysis of a conversation, and limited or open domain speech translation. 

READ MORE

DRONE SURVEILLANCE USING A NON-SCANNING RADAR

Seminar / 30th March / SEECS Seminar Hall, NUST Sector H-12 Islamabad

Ground radar provides a persistence all-weather wide area stand-off surveillance sensor for air targets. However, drones are particularly difficult to detect with conventional scanning radars.
